alert.note: Alert for Trumbull (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 23 at 5:47AM EDT until April 23 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station affecting Trumbull County. For the Eagle Creek (Trumbull)...including Phalanx Station...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Barclay Messerly Road, McConnell East, and Knowlton Roads will be flooded and impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 10.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:00 AM EDT Sunday was 10.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 10.7 feet late this morning. It will then fall late this morning. It will rise to 10.7 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.6 feet on 03/13/1939. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 400 PM EDT.
